
### string instructions (1)  {.smaller}


```
memcpy: // copy %rdx bytes from (%rsi) to (%rdi)
        cmpq %rdx, %rdx
        je done
        movsb
        subq $1, %rdx
        jmp memcpy
done:   ret

```
 

* <code>movsb</code> (move data from string to string, byte)
* mov one byte from <code>(%rsi)</code> to <code>(%rdi)</code>
* increment %rsi and %rdi (*)
* <em>cannot</em> specify other registers


### string instructions (2)  {.smaller}


```
memcpy: // copy %rdx bytes from (%rsi) to (%rdi)
    rep movsb
    ret

```
 

* <code>rep</code> prefix byte 
<hr class="vspace" />
* repeat instruction until <code>%rdx</code> is 0
* decrement <code>%rdx</code> each time
* <em>cannot</em> specify other registers
* <em>cannot</em> use <code>rep</code> with all instructions


### string instructions (3)  {.smaller}


* <code>lodsb</code>, <code>stosb</code> --- load/store into string
* <code>movsw</code>, <code>movsd</code> --- word/dword versions
* string comparison instructions 
<hr class="vspace" />
* <code>rep movsb</code> is still recommended on modern Intel
